boat.description: Felix loves boats.  Here we pretend to see dolphins, crabs and fishermen.  We are unfazed when a six year old points out that there are, in fact, no dolphins in the parking lot.
boat.title: Boat

class1.description: We went to a sibling class at Alta Bates, the hospital where Lucie will be giving birth. The class was specifically targetted at 2 year olds.
class1.title: Class 1

class2.description: Felix learned that babies need to wear a hat and a diaper; and he practiced on Nounours (we had been told to bring a doll or stuffed animal). Then, all the babies got swaddled in blankets.
class2.title: Class 2

class3.description: Then, we toured the maternity ward, to visit a hospital room, and to look at real babies.
class3.title: Class 3

class4.description: Almost done! We read some books and had a little snack. Both Felix and Nounours were hungry from walking through the maternity ward.
class4.title: Class 4

class5.description:
At the end, Felix was given a "Big Brother" certificate. He is ready!

Felix is a bit disappointed because, after all that, the baby is STILL in the belly. "Want my baby out!"
class5.title: Class 5

felix_room.description: Felix's room is looking better and better. Dean painted it blue, and put some posters in it.
felix_room.title: Felix Room

felix_room2.description: And, finally, the piece of furniture we had been waiting for: bookshelves for Felix's book collection.
felix_room2.title: Felix Room 2

habitot1.description:
This week, Lucie and Felix visited Habitot, Berkeley's children discovery museum. Really, it's more of a toddler play paradise than a museum, but they can call it whatever they want. The place is great.

There is an area to play doctor, complete with white coats, doll patients, and medical instruments.
habitot1.title: Habitot 1

habitot2.description:
Lucie quickly learns why most parents kept steering their children away from the Water World exhibit.

Felix spent the rest of his visit at Habitot in a T-shirt and a diaper. Next time, we'll bring a change of clothes!
habitot2.title: Habitot 2

habitot3.description: Foam blocks for a bit of exercise.
habitot3.title: Habitot 3

habitot4.description: Lately, Felix has been fascinated with the concept of buying. He loves to pretend "achète" (buy) stuff at the "marchand de fruits" (fruit market). Habitot had all the right props.
habitot4.title: Habitot 4

nana1.description: Nana came for the weekend.  She gets a big hug at the airport.
nana1.title: Nana 1

outside1.description: The joys of summertime: cooking outside,
outside1.title: Outside 1

outside2.description: ... eating in the shade of your very own apple tree,
outside2.title: Outside 2

outside3.description: ...spending quality time with Grandma, while Papa spies on you from the baby's room,
outside3.title: Outside 3

shoes.description: Felix was complaining that his shoes were "too tight! too tight!" So we went shoe shopping.  His feet are so wide that we only get 1 or 2 models to choose from. He wears a size 10, extra wide.
shoes.title: Shoes

stroller.description: Since the sibling class, Felix has been babying Nounours.
stroller.title: Stroller

toenails.description: Lucie dressed as a barefoot and pregnant Earth mother for our friend Freefrom and Anna's wedding. She painted her toenails, and Felix asked to have his painted as well.
toenails.title: Toenails

tummy1.description: We are exploring Berkeley's outdoor restaurants.
tummy1.title: Tummy 1

tummy2.description: Felix insists he has a baby in his belly, a "petit one".
tummy2.title: Tummy 2

description:
Felix turned 2 1/2, the new baby is a month away, and Nana came for a visit.

Felix explores concepts through pretend play to a degree we don't see in other kids his age. One of the concepts he's exploring right now is fear. He's trying out different fears, like fear of ants and fear of falling off a bicycle. Some are purely playful, like his fear of crabs where he wants Dean to be a crab and chase him into the safely of Lucie's arms. Others, like the bike, have some degree of reality, but he wants to play it up rather than conquer it. When Dean actually gets him into the baby seat on his bike, he loves it. It's fascinating.

On another imagination-related point, Felix hijacked tonight's bedtime story. Dean was making up a story about sleeping on a boat. Felix started inserting stuff into the story: fish sleeping in beds, airplanes overhead, and some sort of hole that was getting rained on by a storm.
title: June 14
